subject: Re: [junit] JUNIT and Databases
msgSnippet: ... You should definitely check that blog suggested by Carl. Also if you haven t checked DbUnit maybe it or some other similar tool can help you some if you
messageBody:
2006/5/10, Carl Hume <carl.hume@...>:
>
> Hello,
>
> I just saw this link posted to the TDD list, and it should give you a good
> starting point: http://langrsoft.com/dbtdd.shtml. It's Jeff Langr's
> blog,
> where he details test driving a data access layer in Java.
>
> Hope this helps!
> Carl

On 5/10/06, Navanga Wanigatunga <navanga@...> wrote:
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > Can someone tell me the best way to test a jdbc class using junit.
> > Currently in my test i insert a record using setup() and then delete it
> > after the test by using teardown().
> >
> > Of course if i dont have a delete method in my jdbc class this will not
> > work, and the unit test will keep adding a record to the database.
> >
> > Is there a better way to do this?
> >
> > Thanks in advance.
> >
>


You should definitely check that blog suggested by Carl. Also if you haven't
checked DbUnit maybe it or some other similar tool can help you some if you
still need db setups etc.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
